en: Hear ye now what Jehovah saith: Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.
hmr: LALPA thu hril chu tuhin lo ngai ta u: Tho la, tlâng lienhai hmaa chun khing la, tlâng chînhai chun i râwl ngai raw se.

en: Hear, O ye mountains, Jehovah’s controversy, and ye enduring foundations of the earth; for Jehovah hath a controversy with his people, and he will contend with Israel.
hmr: Aw tlâng lienhai, LALPA khing- na chu ngai unla, nangni leihnuoi innghatna hlunhai, lo ngai ro; LALPA chu a mihai leh an inkhing a, Israelhai chu khing a tih.

en: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.
hmr: “Aw ka mihai, in chungah ieng am ka thawh a? Ieng kawng âm ka suksâwl cheu a? Mi hung khing ta u.

en: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of bondage; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawk chun ka ṭhuoi suok cheu a, suoka inthawkin kân tlansuok cheu a, in hmaah Mosie hai le, Aron hai le Miriam hai ka hung tir kha.

en: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab devised, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him; remember from Shittim unto Gilgal, that ye may know the righteous acts of Jehovah.
hmr: Aw ka mihai, LALPA thilthaw fel chu in hriet theina dingin, Moab lal Balak thu rawt le Beor naupa Balaamin a dawn dân, Sittima in- thawka Gilgal chenin thil umziehai kha, tuhin hre zing ro.”

en: Wherewith shall I come before Jehovah, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt-offerings, with calves a year old?
hmr: Ieng lêm LALPA hmaa chun hung ka ta, Pathien chunghnung hmaa chun kûn ka ta? Pumraw- hmang thilinhlânhai, bâwngte kum khat mihai leh a hmaa chun ka hung ding am a nih?

en: will Jehovah be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my first-born for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
hmr: LALPA chu berâmchal sâng tamtak amanih, hriek vadung sîng- haia dâm chun a lungawi ding am a nih? Ka bawsietna leiin ka nau lutîr chu ka pêkin, ka thlarau suolna leiin ka taksa ra chu ka pêk ding am a nih?

en: He hath showed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth Jehovah require of thee, but to do justly, and to love kindness, and to walk humbly with thy God?
hmr: Aw mihriem, a ṭha chu ân entir ta che a nih; LALPAIN a phût che chu ieng am a na? Indiktaka thaw le lunginsietna ngainat le i Pathien le thuhnuoirawltaka lêng hmunkhat chu a ni naw am a nih?

en: The voice of Jehovah crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom will see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.
hmr: LALPA chun khawpui chu a khêkkhum a nih, varna nei mi chun i hming chu ṭîng a tih; “Hembâwk le a buotsaitu chu hre ro.

en: Are there yet treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and a scant measure that is abominable?
hmr: Mi rilo ina chun rîtlona robâwmhai chu a la umin inkhina dawrâwm tirdakumtakhai chu a la um rawp am?

en: Shall I be pure with wicked balances, and with a bag of deceitful weights?
hmr: Bûkna indik nawhai le ip rik dân dawhahai leh inthieng ka ni thei ding am a nih?

en: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
hmr: Chutaka mi hausahai chu pâwngnêknain an sip sih a, chutaka chênghai chun khêl an hril a, an bau sûnga an lei chu mi hlêm hmang a nih.

en: Therefore I also have smitten thee with a grievous wound; I have made thee desolate because of thy sins.
hmr: Chuleiin, kei khawma nataka hliemin ka vuok ta cheh a, i suolna- hai leiin râusanah ka siem ta che a nih.

en: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy humiliation shall be in the midst of thee: and thou shalt put away, but shalt not save; and that which thou savest will I give up to the sword.
hmr: Fâk chu fâng i ta, nisienla- khawm, khawp naw ti ni; i kuoma chun i tlâwmna chu um a ta, sawn i ta, nisienlakhawm, himin thak hmang naw ti ni; i fe hmangpuihai khawm chu kâwlhnâmah pe suok tho ka tih.

en: Thou shalt sow, but shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but shalt not anoint thee with oil; and the vintage, but shalt not drink the wine.
hmr: Chîng chu chîng i ta, sîk naw ti ni, oliv rahai chu sirsâwr i ta, nisien- lakhawm, a hriek chu nâl naw ti ni; grêp ra chu sâwr la khawm, a uoin chu dâwn naw ti ni.

en: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I may make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof a hissing: and ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
hmr: Omri thuruothai chu vawng zing a ni sih a, Ahab sûngkuo thil- thaw po pohai leh; an remruothaia chun in fe a nih; chuleiin, hmun râusanah ka siem ta ding che a nih, a sûnga chênghai hi nuizatbûr dingin; chun, ka mihai hmingsietna chu phur in tih.”
